      17

      Convergence of the Gauss-Newton Approach

      • If is close to an equality then provides a strictly better fit than unless is already a local minimum

      • So if we start very close to a local minimum (so the linear approximation holds in a very close neighborhood), this will converge

      • But no guarantee if you start further away.

      20

      Some More Modifications: Levenberg

      • Instead of one could simply follow steepest gradient to
      • The latter always leads to improvement but could be slow, the former is quicker if is linear in the neighbourhood of
      • Levenberg: Combine the two approaches, i.e., use
      • Adjust in each iteration, if there is quick descent then keep it low, otherwise increase it so you are closer to steepest descent

      Ramesh Hariharan

      Some More Modifications: Marquardt

      • When is large so one is in the steepest descent regime, move faster in directions where the partial derivative is smaller, in a bid to accelerate
